První nález kříska leknínového - Erotettix cyane (Boheman, 1845) na jižní Moravě / First record of the Pondweed Leafhopper - Erotettix cyane (Boheman, 1845) from South Moravia
Article
Full-text available
  • Dec 2021
  • Zdeněk Mačát
  • Antonín Reiter
In this paper, we provide the first record of the Pondweed Leafhopper (Erotettix cyane) from South Moravia, Czech Republic. We found a population of this species during a herpetologi-cal survey of the Líšný fishpond near the villages of Hostim and Rozkoš in the district of Znojmo. The population inhabits a small, recently built pool (49° 01' 04" N,...

Male-male amplexus between two amphibian families
Article
Full-text available
  • Feb 2021
  • Zdeněk Mačát
  • Daniel Jablonski
  • Antonín Reiter
The amplexus between two different anuran males is observed very rarely. Therefore, here we provide the first documented observation of a long-lasting male-male amplexus between Bombina bombina (Bombinatoridae) and Hyla arborea (Hylidae) together with an overview of the data published in literature. The observed mating pattern is reported from Sout...

Rozšíření obojživelníků na Znojemsku– žáby (Anura) Distribution of Amphibians in Znojmo region – Anura
Article
Full-text available
  • Dec 2020
  • Antonín Reiter
  • Zdeněk Mačát
In this paper, data on the occurrence of frogs in the Znojmo region are summarised for the first time. Both published data and especially a large dataset of own records from the years 1992–2020 were assessed. In total, 7781 faunistic records were assessed, 7463 of them include an exact species identification, localisation and date of the finding. I...

The maternal origin of isolated populations of the common wall lizard (Podracis muralis) in the Czech Republic, representing the northeastern range border of the species, was addressed. Lovčík mokřadní Dolomedes plantarius (Clerck, 1757) (Araneae: Pisauridae) v povodí řeky Dyje - FEN RAFT SPIDER Dolomedes plantarius (CLERCK, 1757) (ARANEAE: PISAURIDAE) IN THE DYJE RIVER BASIN
Article
Full-text available
  • Dec 2018
  • Ondřej Machač
  • Zdeněk Mačát
  • Aleš J E L Í N E K
  • Antonín Reiter
New faunistic records and all known records of Dolomedes plantarius from the Dyje river basin are presented in this paper. D. plantarius is a rare spider species which lives among vegetation in littorals of ponds and on wetlands.   • Dec 2016
  • Antonín Reiter
  • Zdeněk Mačát
  • Lenka Jeřábková
The presented paper summarizes historical and actual information on the distribution of caudate amphibians in the Znojmo region. Until the last decade of the 20th century the faunistic data concerning the distribution of amphibians in the region were very scarce. The beginning of systematic faunistic research dates from 1992. Erythrism in the Smooth Snake, Coronella austriaca (Laurenti, 1768), Recorded from Georgia
Article
Full-text available
  • Apr 2016
  • Zdeněk Mačát
  • David Hegner
  • Daniel Jablonski
Color aberration are frequently known in snakes, however erythrism is one of the rarest. In this paper, we report the capture of one erythristic male of Coronella austriaca from Georgia and we also present actual knowledge about color aberration in this species.

Morphological abnormalities occur frequently in wild amphibian populations. We analysed malformation and injuries in the hybrid zone of three crested newt species, in the Czech Republic. Parasitic relations between animals are very common in wild nature. In this paper, we studied levels of infection in three-spined stickleback with plerocercoids of Schistocephalus solidus from Puck Bay (Baltic Sea, Poland). The durability and toxicity of nail polish marks used in field studies on the woodlouse, Porcellio scaber, were evaluated in the laboratory. Six groups of 40 individuals were each kept on different substrates (two groups each on loamy soil, sand and gravel), with three groups of marked and three groups of unmarked woodlice as a control.
